body:
Did you see some logs like this? Or some other related logs?
 
```
Head commit id of auto merge %-v does not match sha [%s], it may means the head branch has been updated. Just ignore this request because a new request expected in the queue
```

body:
If you can build your own binary, could you try this fix?  Start automerge check again after the conflict check #34989 

I think one of the problems is that when a PR is being checked for conflicts, then the automerge check will be skipped, then the automerge will never happen. As you found:

> After diving into the code I suspect that there might an issue with the [notification of commit statuses](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/blob/f88800d54505f30dbae089d446e292f176222d99/services/automerge/notify.go#L51): the pull request [might still check if it is mergeable](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/blob/f88800d54505f30dbae089d446e292f176222d99/services/pull/check.go#L395) and thus the automerge is not triggered.



 I added some code to start the automerge check again after the conflict check

I am able to build the docker image and deploy it for testing. Unfortunately #34989 does not fix the issue. My conclusion was not correct, after some log-style debugging I now think the issue is with the merge request via API when all status checks are already completed before triggering auto merge.

With the following patch (based on #34989  fix-automerge), I can resolve the issue:

```patch
diff --git a/services/automerge/automerge.go b/services/automerge/automerge.go
index 588ce0d195..3d5741df5d 100644
--- a/services/automerge/automerge.go
+++ b/services/automerge/automerge.go
@@ -65,6 +65,12 @@ func ScheduleAutoMerge(ctx context.Context, doer *user_model.User, pull *issues_
                _, err = issues_model.CreateAutoMergeComment(ctx, issues_model.CommentTypePRScheduledToAutoMerge, pull, doer)
                return err
        })
+
+       if scheduled && err == nil {
+               log.Trace("Pull request [%d] scheduled for auto merge with style [%s] and message [%s]", pull.ID, style, message)
+               automergequeue.StartPRCheckAndAutoMerge(ctx, pull)
+       }
+
        return scheduled, err
 }
```

I think I can reproduce that behavior on the demo instance.

---

Now this behavior is similar to the UI with no "auto-merge" available when the statuses are already green. However I think the API should either return an error in that case or do the auto merge instead.

I have edited the original script and how to reproduce is basically this:

1. create branch + push changes
2. add success status to that commit
3. create PR
4. schedule auto merge via API

Now the PR is seemingly "stuck" at auto merge because it could have been merged directly.

> With the following patch (based on [#34989](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/pull/34989) fix-automerge), I can resolve the issue:

Awesome, I will merge it into that fix and (and add co-author), and try to add some tests

I push a commit to  #34989 : https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/pull/34989/commits/ab0581093f4d764171ec2c6705ce6ed9386103d4

I don't know your email address, so I only left the commit message as "Co-authored-by: posativ". If you'd like to use an email in the commit, feel free to tell me and I will add it in the final squash merge.

----

> Now this behavior is similar to the UI with no "auto-merge" available when the statuses are already green. However I think the API should either return an error in that case or do the auto merge instead.

I think it's fine to trigger automerge and then merge after the schedule when the PR is merge-able. Indeed there should be no difference from "after the scheduled automerge then the PR becomes merge-able immediately and gets merged" IMO since it is really merge-able. What do you think?

Yes, I expect the automerge to just happen in this case.

No further attribution needed from my side, thank you for your help and work!
